findings.title: Contract is not trustless
findings.description: The contract relies heavily on the owner's actions, which can lead to high risks for users, including not respecting the soft cap, not returning overpaid ETH, not burning remaining tokens, and pausing/unpausing the token at will.

findings.title: Not respecting the soft cap
findings.description: The contract does not respect the soft cap, which can lead to security risks and trust issues for users.

findings.title: Not returning overpaid ETH
findings.description: The contract does not return excess Ether paid during a transaction.

findings.title: Pausing and unpausing the token at will
findings.description: The owner has the ability to pause and unpause the token at will, which can incur high risk for users.

findings.title: Multiple contract versions in the same codebase
findings.description: The contracts rely on an outdated version (1.5.0) of the Open Zeppelin framework to manage ERC20 standard functions, with different versions used for functions (1.8.0/1.6.0) and outdated CycledCrowdsale and Whitelist contracts in the flat file.

findings.title: [EIP20 API Approve / TransferFrom] multiple withdrawal attack
findings.description: The CycledToken.sol contract is vulnerable to a multiple withdrawal attack due to improper implementation of EIP20 API Approve and TransferFrom functions.
